newsitem.title: HUNGARY: SOARING TURNOVER ON HUNGARY BCE SEEN CONTINUING.
newsitem.headline: SOARING TURNOVER ON HUNGARY BCE SEEN CONTINUING.

text.p: January to August turnover on the Budapest Commodity Exchange (BCE) has reached a record figure of 456.7 billion forints, a BCE official said on Tuesday.
"This figure is twice the turnover of the first six years," BCE spokesman Attila Lovas told Reuters.
He added, that trading on the BCE started late 1989, and the turnover for 1989 and 1990 - they do not have separate figures for the two years - was 574 million forints.
Total turnover for 1996 is expected to be around 600 billion forints, he said.
Of the BCE's three sections the financial section accounts for the bulk of total turnover.

The BCE's financial section offers futures contracts for seven currencies and three-month deposit interest rates, and will add the one- and three-month Budapest Interbank Offered Rate (BUBOR) from September 19.

The BCE's two other sections, trades traditional commodity goods. The grain section this year traded 30 percent of Hungary's grain production, while the livestock section is expected to double its turnover this year, the BCE said.
